text: I've that idealistic thought in my mind, about streamlining ProtoBuf.jl and StructTypes.jl such that the former is generating code from proto files that matches the API of the latter. But for that I rn am not entirely sure I understood it correctly. StructTypes is a valid API for both, binary as well as textual de/serialization, isn't it?

elements.text: I've that idealistic thought in my mind, about streamlining ProtoBuf.jl and StructTypes.jl such that the former is generating code from proto files that matches the API of the latter. But for that I rn am not entirely sure I understood it correctly. StructTypes is a valid API for both, binary as well as textual de/serialization, isn't it?

text: StructTypes itself doesn’t provide any kind of serialzation; it provides utilities for programmatic processing of _kinds of types_

elements.text: StructTypes itself doesn’t provide any kind of serialzation; it provides utilities for programmatic processing of

text: So yes, StructTypes can work equally well for both binary and textual cases. Probably the best place to get more familiar with how to use StructTypes is the structs.jl file in the JSON3.jl repo
